extension.description: Captify Content displays the image assigned to your category or section and the title using the awesome captifyScript. If the section or category does not have an image assigned to it then it will not show. To assign an image to the section or category go to the section or category manager open the section/category and select an image from the drop down list. Please note the image must be located in the images/stories folder of joomla which is the default folder for the section and category images to be stored anyway. Please note that you need to have the JB Library plugin installed and published for this module to work as desired.

field.name: type
field.label: Image Content source
field.description: Select whether to display categories or Joomla content items.

field.name: count
field.label: Item Count
field.description: The number of items to display (default is 5)

field.name: imagesPerRow
field.label: Items Per Row
field.description: Set the number of images to be per row.

field.name: titleBelow
field.label: Display title below image
field.description: Display the title below the image

field.default: The following options allow you to disable css and javascript files loaded by this module. If you are using the Zen Grid Framework version 2 the framework will automatically load the relevant css and js files if you leave this setting enabled.

field.name: scripts
field.label: Load CSS?
field.description: When enabled all relevant css and javascript is loaded via the module or int he case of users who use the Zen Grid Framework - the framework. If you want to disable all css and javascript from loading via this instance of the module disable this option.

field.name: category_filtering_type
field.label: Category Filtering Type
field.description: Select Inclusive to Include the selcted categories or Exclusive to Exclude the selected categories

field.name: show_child_category_articles
field.label: Child Categories
field.description: Choose to include child categories in the above category selection

field.name: levels
field.label: Category Depth
field.description: Specify the number of sub category levels to be included

field.name: articleinfo
field.default: The following options are particularly relevant to using articles as a source of Captify images. Picking a value of Select all Articles will not filter any articles except by the category selctions above. If you have chosen to display images from categories then the following settings can be ignored.

field.name: show_front
field.label: Show Featured Articles
field.description: Choose to show, hide or show only featured articles

field.name: article_filtering_type
field.label: Article Filtering Type
field.description: Select Inclusive to Include the selected articles or Exclusive to Exclude the selected articles

field.name: artid
field.label: Articles
field.description: Select the articles to use for content filtering
field.query: SELECT id, title FROM #__content ORDER BY title

field.name: author_filtering_type
field.label: Author Filtering Type
field.description: Select Inclusive to Include the selcted authors or Exclusive to Exclude the selected authors

field.name: created_by
field.label: Authors
field.description: Select the Authors to use for category filtering
field.query: select id, name, username from #__users where id IN (select distinct(created_by) from #__content) order by name ASC

field.name: ordering
field.label: Ordering
field.description: Ordering options

field.name: ordering_direction
field.label: Ordering Direction
field.description: Choose to order articles by the above selection option in ascending or descing order.

field.name: c_show_child_category_articles
field.label: Child Categories
field.description: Choose to include child categories in the above category selection

field.name: c_levels
field.label: Category Depth
field.description: Specify the number of sub category levels to be included

field.name: k2contentSource
field.label: K2 Content Source
field.description: Set this option to select if you want to specify the category that this module should draw it's content from.

field.name: itemid
field.label: Item Filtering
field.description: The following options are useful for selecting or omitting individual items. Select All Articles will result in the category filter being the only effective filter.

field.name: itemFilter
field.label: Featured Items
field.description: Select whether to display all items or only featured

field.name: orderingK2
field.label: Ordering
field.description: Ordering options

field.name: displayImages
field.label: K2 Image source
field.description: Choose to use the K2 item image or the first image in the K2 content.

field.name: image_width
field.label: Width of the resized image
field.description: Set the width of the resized image.

field.name: image_height
field.label: Height of the resized image
field.description: Set the width of the resized image.

field.name: option
field.label: Resize Method
field.description: The method you would like to use when resizing images.

field.name: imageDimensions
field.label: Output image height and width?
field.description: This option when enabled prints the height and width of the images as a style declaration. This option is beneficial for site loading and seo but may have adverse results if the crop width and height ratios do not match the image width and image heights of the original image

field.name: rightMargin
field.label: Thumbnail right margin
field.description: Enter a px unit for the right margin of the images. Applied if equalising margins are disabled.

field.name: bottomMargin
field.label: Thumbnail bottom margin
field.description: Enter a px unit for the bottom margin of the images.

field.name: useCaptify
field.label: Enable the hover effect?
field.description: Set this option to yes if you want to display the transition effect when hovering over the item. By setting this option to no you can use the captify module as an image menu that directs the user to the content, categories or sections when clicked.

field.name: background
field.label: Background Theme
field.description: Enable image fade effects on page load and mouse hover

field.name: transition
field.label: Overlay Transition Type
field.description: Select the type of transition used to display the overlay title when the image is moused over.

field.name: position
field.label: Overlay Position
field.description: Original positioning of the overlay effect

field.name: speed
field.label: Transition Speed In
field.description: The speed that the captify transition should occur in ms.

field.name: speedOut
field.label: Transition Speed Out
field.description: The speed that the captify transition should occur in ms after the mouse leaves the image.

field.name: fadeEffect
field.label: Image Fade on Hover
field.description: Enable image fade effects on page load and mouse hover

field.name: cache
field.label: Caching
field.description: Select whether to cache the content of this module

field.name: cache_time
field.label: Cache Time
field.description: The time before the module is recached
